arm_group.description: Lesions will be treated with experimental adhesive and dental restorative composite materials without the use of pretreatment of the dentin and enamel using phosphoric acid.
Lesions will be treated with experimental adhesive and dental restorative composite materials with the use of pretreatment of the dentin and enamel using phosphoric acid.

brief_summary.textblock:
The intent of this study is to evaluate the clinical performance of an experimental dental
      bonding agent for use with dental restorative composites with and without pretreatment of
      the tooth dentin and enamel using phosphoric acid etching.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Study of Experimental Dental Adhesive With and Without Phosphoric Acid Pretreatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients in need of Class I and Class II restorations in premolars and molars.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with fewer than 20 teeth

          -  Patients exhibiting poor oral hygiene or uncontrolled periodontal disease

          -  Pregnant women or lactating mothers

          -  Patients with known allergies to HEMA or resin-based materials

          -  Patients with medical conditions that would contraindicate dental treatment

          -  Patients with xerostomia

intervention.intervention_name: Experimental adhesive, SureFil SDR Flow base, Esthet-X HD restorative material.
Phosphoric acid, experimental adhesive, SureFil SDR Flow base, Esthet-X HD restorative material.

clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of an Experimental Universal Adhesive Used With and Without Phosphoric Acid Pretreatment in Posterior Composite Resin Restorations

primary_outcome.description:
The restoration's color will be assessed for matching with adjacent teeth and stability of color matching over time. Assessments will be done to the following criteria:
A= Restoration matches adjacent tooth structure in shade and/or translucency. B= Mismatch in shade and/or translucency is within normal range of tooth shades.
C= Mismatch in shade and/or translucency is outside normal range of tooth shades.
primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of change in color matching of restoration.

primary_outcome.description:
The margin of the restoration  will be assessed for discoloration according to the following criteria:
A= No visual evidence of marginal discoloration. B= Marginal discoloration present but has not penetrated in a pulpal direction. C= Marginal discoloration has penetrated in a pulpal direction.
primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of change in marginal discoloration

primary_outcome.description:
The integrity of the restoration's margin will be assessed according to the following criteria:
A= Explorer does not catch or slight catch with no visible crevice. B= Explorer catches and crevice is visible but no exposure of dentin or base. C= Explorer penetrates crevice and defect extended to amelo-dentinal junction. D= Restoration is fractured, mobile, or missing in part or in toto.
primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of change in marginal integrity.

primary_outcome.description:
The assessment of the presence of secondary dental caries (cavities) will be performed according to the following criteria:
A= No caries present. D= Caries present associated with the restoration.
primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of change in presence of secondary dental caries (cavities).

primary_outcome.description:
The restoration will be assessed for the presence of fractures according to the following criteria:
A= Smooth restoration surface with no irregularities. B= Slightly rough or pitted restoration surface. Can be refinished. C= Deeply pitted or grooved (not related to anatomy) restoration finish. Can not be refinished.
D= Restoration surface is fractured or flaking.
primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of change in presence of restoration fractures (localized or bulk).

primary_outcome.description:
Patient will be interviewed to assess post-operative sensitivity according to the following criteria:
A= No sensitivity. B= Mild sensitivity. C= Moderate sensitivity with no restoration replacement required. D= Sever sensitivity. Replacement of restoration is required.
primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of change in post-operative sensitivity.

primary_outcome.description:
The condition of the surface of the restoration will be assessed according to the following criteria:
A= Restoration is continuous with existing anatomic form. B= Restoration is discontinuous with existing anatomic form but missing material is not sufficient to expose dentin or lining.
C= Sufficient restorative material is lost to expose dentin.
primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of change in surface condition of restoration.

primary_outcome.description:
The condition of the patient's gingiva will be assessed according to the following index:
0 = Normal gingiva.
= Mild inflammation, slight change in color, slight edema, no bleeding upon probing.
= Moderate inflammation, redness; edema and glazing; bleeding upon palpation.
= Severe inflammation, marked redness and edema, ulceration, tendency to spontaneous bleeding.
primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of change in gingival inflammation index.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
